title: Oppo K12s teased ahead of April 22 launch, massive battery inside

html:
Oppo's K12 family is going to add a new member pretty soon. We're talking about the Oppo K12s, which will become official on April 22 according to the brand itself.

The phone has a 7,000 mAh battery with support for 80W wired charging, and Oppo promises the battery will go a whopping 1,800 cycles or five years without losing more than 20% of its capacity. Oppo has also shared a bunch of official images of the K12s, which will be offered in white, purple, and black.


Oppo K12s official images

Based on a recent certification by TENAA of an Oppo phone that looks just like this one, the K12s is likely to come with a 6.67-inch FHD+ AMOLED screen, an in-display fingerprint sensor, 8/12GB of RAM, 128/256/512GB of storage, a 50 MP main camera, a 2 MP decorative sensor, and a 16 MP selfie camera. The device is powered by the Snapdragon 6 Gen 4 SoC based on a benchmark run.

Source (in Chinese)
